nodes.title: Strength in Surrender: Surrendering Your Practice
God's Glory Revealed
nodes.description: Every human interaction is an opportunity to reveal Christ's glory. Christ dwelling in our hearts through the ministry of the Holy Spirit shines out of our lives with His glory to reveal His character to the world. It is this revelation of Christ's glory that will lighten this dark world with the beauty of His character.

nodes.title: A Case Study in Faith
nodes.description: In this presentation, Dr. Shin will share a remarkable case study of a patient with acute myeloid leukemia and her family's journey as they struggle with issues of faith in the face of a terminal illness. In the context of this patient's story, Dr. Shin will explore the challenges of sharing one's faith in the hospital setting, the role of faith when medicine offers no hope, and what it truly means to be a co-worker with Christ.

nodes.title: Reflecting Christ in the Match
nodes.description: Applying for a residency position through the Match is a daunting task. So many voices urge you to make the best decisions for yourself to make sure you "get in" to a program. But could a random process like the Match be an opportunity to reflect Christ? Come hear about how God used a challenging residency application season to glorify His name, through the Match.

nodes.title: What to do to avoid/treat burnout: Enhancing Emotional Wellbeing
nodes.description: OBJECTIVES At the conclusion of this CME activity, the learner should be better able to: 1. Identify how to recognize burn out. 2. Understand key lifestyle factors that avoid burnout. 3. When the cat is out of the bag—know how to treat burnout. 4. Understand the most important Christian principle that reverses burnout. 6. Demonstrate how to fulfill that need once it is recognized.

nodes.title: Strength in Surrender: Surrendering Your Profession
I Believe in Miracles
nodes.description: C.S. Lewis, in his book "Miracles," wrote that there are two types of people in the world: naturalists and supernaturalists. We will be exploring the righteousness of Christ as illustrated through His miraculous healing ministry within the gospel accounts.

nodes.title: The Glymphatic System, Glaucoma, and Outer Space
nodes.description: OBJECTIVES 1. Give an overview of the glymphatic system in the brain—the relatively recent findings of CSF (cerebral spinal fluid) exchange which occurs during sleep. 2. Explore how sleep deprivation can contribute to neurodegenerative disease such as Alzheimer’s, Parkinson’s, dementia, and possibly glaucoma. 3. Examine the recent theories of why astronauts are losing their vision during long-term space flight. 4. Show how the knowledge of the above topics can affect our medical decision making process as we treat glaucoma on a daily basis.

nodes.title: A Combined Work â€“ Physicians & Ministers
nodes.description: OBJECTIVES 1. Understand the Spirit of Prophecy council on ministers and physicians working together. 2. Discuss the relationship dynamics between pastors and physicians. 3. Identify opportunities in your church to improve medical evangelism.
